Azureblade: Arghhh!!! Can't.... go... on.... got... me.... this... time!

H=
e had to escape. He was not going to make it as is. Whatever those
things w=
ere, they were too strong for him to resist for long. He did
the only thing=
 he thought possible...

His body suddenly went limp. There was no more ene=
rgy into it. It fell
face first on the moon's surface, raising a growing cl=
oud of dust
where it did.

> Back at Minion base:
> 
> "Fascinatin=
g." that one word echoed through the large darkened chamber.
> 
> Vorpal tu=
rned from his position on his throne, powerful optics bored
> into Krytek, =
"Report."
>

gainst it."
> The information began to scroll across Vorpral's screens as w=
ell, even
> as Krytek's emotionless tones continued, "Our modified X-6 unit=
s are
> attempting leech energy from the subject, and yet the subject is st=
ill
> attempting to both disable Animus and co-opt our units as well."
> 
>=
 Vorpral chuckled from his throne, "He is strong. Is he having any
> succes=
s in stealing our units?"
> 
> "No sir." Krytek's hands moved smoothly acro=
ss his control panel as he
> spoke. "I am countermanding any spurious order=
s they are receiving, and
> am setting up encrypted command codes. The X-6 =
units are
> unsophisticated units, had I not been monitoring them, it is po=
ssible

 optics dimmed as his own screens still showed the estimated

onus' arrival, they were nearly here. "Continue with the

pprise Cyclonus of the situation."

cknowledged the command.

> Back on=
 the surface of the moon:

reBlade: Wha... ? [He staggers a bit] Hold on, Minion, I'll take

f you in a moment.

d instead concentrates

 his armor repairs

s, trying to

im. The

hing.

missile at point blank range at Animus.

> The spheres successfully resis=
t the attempt to be repaired even as they
> continue to attempt to leech po=
wer from Azureblade. As he fired his
> missiles tendrils of energy lash out=
 out at the missiles from a few of
> the spheres scoring their hulls and ca=
using their power levels to drop.
> 
> The missiles though still maintain m=
uch of their deadly power, although
> Animus does not. Animus continued to =
back away smiling at Azureblade
> until he sees the twin streaks launch at =
him. With a last ditch effort
> he attempts to throw up a shield, but it is=
 not enough ... 
> 
> **BOOM!!** 
> 
> Flames erupt from the point of impac=
t and debris is ripped from the
> ground: stone, rock, metal all scatter ac=
ross the surface of the ground
> as a new crater appears on the surface of =
the moon. If Animus survived,
> he is no longer visible to the naked optic.=

> 
> Above Azureblade in the distance something like a large black fog
> d=
rifted between him and the sun for a moment. If an observer had
> binocular=
 vision they might determine they are ships, many of them. As
> quickly and=
 silently as the apparition came it began to drift on. At
> the last moment=
 though, just as the last of the armada was vanishing
> into the ebony back=
drop of space, five units detached from the main
> group and began moving a=
t high speed toward Azureblade's location. Even
> as this happened the sphe=
res attached to Azureblade's frame grew

o leech power from him, draining from
